contentrichtext.text: {{Distinguish2|[[hentai|Adult comics]] ({{Nihongo2|[[:ja:成年漫画|成年漫画]]}}, also read as "seinen manga")}} {{Unreferenced|date=September 2010}} {{Anime and manga}} {{Nihongo|'''''Seinen'' manga'''|青年漫画}} is a subset of [[manga]] that is generally targeted at a 18–30 year old male audience, but the audience can be older with some manga aimed at [[businessmen]] well into their 40s. In Japanese, the word [[wikt:seinen|''Seinen'']] means "young man" or "young men" and is not suggestive of sexual matters. (The female equivalent to seinen manga is [[josei manga]].) It has a wide variety of art styles and more variation in subject matter, ranging from the [[avant-garde]] to the mundane and to the [[pornography|pornographic]]. Because of the emphasis on storyline and character development instead of action, some seinen series are often confused with [[shōjo manga|shōjo]], or girls' manga.{{Citation needed|date=July 2010}} This is especially true of seinen comedy series such as ''[[Chobits]]'', and ''[[Chi's Sweet Home]]'', or seinen drama such as ''[[Twin Spica]]''. Other examples of seinen manga include:<!-- We don't need a list of 10,000 examples. --> ''[[Akira (manga)|Akira]]'', ''[[Monster (manga)|Monster]]'', ''[[Gantz]]'', ''[[20th Century Boys]]'', ''[[Berserk (manga)|Berserk]]'', ''[[Battle Royale (manga)|Battle Royale]]'', ''[[Blame!]]'', ''[[Vagabond (manga)|Vagabond]]'', ''[[Ghost in the Shell]]'', ''[[Hellsing]]'', ''[[Black Lagoon]]'', ''[[Ikigami: The Ultimate Limit|Ikigami]]'', ''[[Elfen Lied]]'', ''[[Another (novel)|Another]]'', ''[[Battle Angel Alita]]'', ''[[Zetman]]'', ''[[Drifters (manga)|Drifters]]'' and ''[[Maison Ikkoku]]''. A common way to tell if a manga is seinen is by looking at whether or not [[furigana]] is used over the original [[kanji]] text: if there are furigana on all kanji, the title is generally aimed at a younger audience. The title of the magazine it was published in is also an important indicator. Usually [[Japan]]ese manga magazines with the word "young" in the title (''[[Weekly Young Jump]]'' for instance) are seinen. Other popular seinen manga magazines include ''[[Ultra Jump]]'', ''[[Afternoon (magazine)|Afternoon]]'', and ''[[Big Comic]]''. ==List of seinen manga== {{maincat|Seinen manga}} ==See also== * [[Shōnen manga]]: intended for boys * [[Shōjo manga]]: intended for girls * [[Josei manga]]: intended for adult women * [[Kodomo manga]]: intended for boys and girls * [[List of manga magazines#Seinen magazines|List of seinen magazines]] ==External links== * [http://www.j-magazine.or.jp/data_001/main_b.html#003 Japanese Magazine Publishers Association] {{ja icon}} {{Wiktionary|seinen}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Seinen Manga}} [[Category:Japanese words and phrases]] [[Category:Anime and manga terminology]] [[Category:Seinen manga| Seinen]]
